hero.title: What is Scientism poetry
hero.subtitle: Scientism Poetry integrates the philosophy, theories, and methodologies of science into its creative writing, positioning science as a core means of understanding the world and exploring truth. By blending reason with emotion, it delves into the deep connections between nature, the universe, and the human spirit, showcasing a unique combination of aesthetic and intellectual richness through various forms.
hero.slogan: Let your poetry and science craft a masterpiece

featuredBook.title: Featured Book
featuredBook.description: "An Introduction to Scientism Poetry" is a pioneering work that systematically constructs the theory of scientism poetry, defining its principles, creative manifesto, methodology, and classic examples. The author integrates scientific philosophy, theories, and methods into poetic creation, establishing science as a central approach to understanding the world and exploring truth. Through the fusion of reason and emotion, the work delves into the profound connections between nature, the universe, and the human spiritual realm, presenting its unique aesthetic and intellectual depth in diverse forms.

featuredPoem.title: Featured Poem
featuredPoem.poemText:
Soaring at ten thousand meters high,
Freedom bound by seatbelt, I fly.
Position and momentum, unknown at once,
A whisper of Copenhagen’s brilliance stuns.

The plane’s tail pursued by the first light,
The fuselage slides through the endless night.
The pilot presses on with steady grace,
Above, starlight spills in endless space.

Through oval windows, city lights gleam,
Like scattered stars in an ever-shifting stream.
Amber and white in a steady flare,
Sendai appears, no god nor stage to share.

White clouds form a giant’s thought,
Openness where humanity’s glow is caught.
Oppenheimer nods from the screen,
Lost in thoughts of Einstein, unseen.

A sun-browned seatmate, relaxed at ease,
Bound for Saigon, where dreams take their leave.
Opportunities bloom, the world unfolds,
Ancestors rest beneath the wild grass that holds.

Living between returns, no end in sight,
The Earth split in fractured flight.
A gleam at the wingtip, soft and bright,
A masked attendant’s voice, polite and light:
“Western or Asian meal, sir, tonight?”

association.title: Association
association.description: The International Scientific Poetry Association is a Canada-registered nonprofit organization dedicated to merging scientific reasoning with poetic artistry, fostering a profound integration of science and the humanities, and advocating for the advancement of scientific poetry.

journal.title: Journal
journal.description: Cosmic Rhymes, the official journal of the ISPA, is dedicated to merging science and poetry. It explores the profound interplay between scientific thought and human emotion, celebrating the unique beauty where science and art converge.

press.title: Press
press.description: Canadian Beaver Press is a multidisciplinary publishing house in collaboration with the ISPA, specializing in cross-disciplinary works that bridge literature, science, philosophy, and the arts, fostering innovation and creative synergy.

workshops.title: Canadian Beaver Publishing
workshops.description: Based in Toronto, Canadian Beaver Publishing is renowned for promoting high-quality literary works and blending science, art, and literature. As a key partner of the International Scientific Poetry Association, the publisher supports creators in transforming their work into print or digital publications, advancing the global reach of scientific poetry.
